rgb_hsl.color

Class Color

  • java.lang.Object
    • rgb_hsl.color.Color
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HSLColor, RGBColor

    public abstract class Color
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Color represents the root class for different color spaces. Color spaces represent different ways of describing Color. HSL and RGB color spaces are isomorphic to three dimensional real space. As such, this class should only serve as a root for color spaces that are also isomorphic to three dimensional space.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Noah Teshima

      • Color

        public Color()

    • Method Detail

      • setColor

        public abstract void setColor(double elementA,
                              double elementB,
                              double elementC)
        Set the current color, given three distinct elements. Both RGB and HSL spaces are isomorphic to three dimensional real space, so three distinct elements are needed in either cases to define a color.
        Parameters:
        elementA - double value containing elementA
        elementB - double value containing elementB
        elementC - double value containing elementC

      • getHSLColor

        public static HSLColor getHSLColor(Color color)
        Accessor method used to get the given color in HSL space.
        Parameters:
        color - Color reference containing the color to get in HSL space.
        Returns:
        HSLColor object containing the given color in HSL space.

      • getRGBColor

        public static RGBColor getRGBColor(Color color)
        Accessor method used to get the given color in RGB space.
        Parameters:
        color - Color reference containing the color to get in RGB space.
        Returns:
        RGBColor object containing the given color in RGB space.
